title: Drawing, "Study of a Boy Carpenter", 1730–60
medium: Black and white crayon on grayish-blue laid paper
markings: Collector stamps, in red ink, lower left: Charles Gasc (Lugt 543); in blue ink, lower left: Amédée-Paul-Emile Gasc (Lugt 1131)
provenance: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; Charles Gasc and Amédée-Paul-Emile Gasc
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Boy is shown turned toward left and writing upon a beam, which lies on the soil. Left hand holds a chisel, right raises a hammer.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study of a Boy Carpenter", 1730–60.
1730–60. Black and white crayon on grayish-blue laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-71-49.
